Question: [CySA] Which process involves identifying, assessing, and addressing security weaknesses in an organization’s information systems?
QuestionPlural: [CySA] Which processes involve identifying, assessing, and addressing security weaknesses in an organization’s information systems?
Distractors: Network Optimization||Software Development||Data Backup||Cloud Migration||User Training||Database Administration||Hardware Maintenance||Application Testing||Network Monitoring
Explanation: Vulnerability management focuses on identifying, assessing, and addressing security weaknesses in information systems.||Network optimization improves performance but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Software development creates applications but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Data backup ensures data recovery but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Cloud migration involves moving data to cloud platforms but does not focus on security weaknesses.||User training educates employees but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Database administration manages data storage but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Hardware maintenance ensures physical system functionality but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Application testing verifies software functionality but does not focus on security weaknesses.||Network monitoring tracks traffic but does not focus on security weaknesses.

Question: [CySA] What is the primary purpose of patch management in vulnerability management?
QuestionPlural: [CySA] What are the primary purposes of patch management in vulnerability management?
Corrects: Applying software updates to address known vulnerabilities
Distractors: Enhancing user interface design||Archiving old system logs||Optimizing database queries||Conducting employee surveys||Migrating to new hardware||Generating financial reports||Training new hires||Designing marketing materials||Implementing access controls
Explanation: Patch management applies software updates to fix known vulnerabilities, ensuring system protection.||Enhancing user interface design focuses on usability but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Archiving old system logs is for compliance but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Optimizing database queries improves performance but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Conducting employee surveys gathers feedback but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Migrating to new hardware involves physical changes but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Generating financial reports handles data analysis but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Training new hires focuses on onboarding but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Designing marketing materials is creative work but does not specifically fix software flaws.||Implementing access controls manages permissions but does not specifically fix software flaws.
